oai_dc:dc.dc:description: =kasin follows his dogs to a hyena's hole. The dogs pull the hyena out and =kasin shoots it. He sees a snake under a rock and runs home, where the people accuse him of being angry like the snake and disagreeable at home. 1) p.3468v: the Dutch name for the snake is swart slang, 2) p.3470v: the family told =kasin that he had now met a snake as angry and disagreeable as himself, 3) This story is found in Book IV-1.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd |xam notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: =kasin shoots a hyena
